column2: I have a certain amount of math intelligence and can't really do much to change it.
I can learn new math skills but can't really change my basic math intelligence.
My math intelligence is something about me that I can't change very much.
No matter who you are, you can significantly change your math intelligence level.
When I work hard, it makes me feel as though I am not very smart.
When something is hard, I want to work on it more, not less.
I prefer difficult math problems, where I can learn new things even if I make mistakes
I prefer easy math problems, where I can get the answers correct with little struggle or confusion
